ai-pli-tv-pvr4:3.1_0: Herein, what is the five offenses?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:3.2_0: an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, and an offense entailing confession,
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:3.3_0: These are the five offenses for which there are.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:4.1_0: Herein, what are the five aggregates?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:4.2_0: the offenses entailing expulsion, the belly wrapped in an offense entailing suspension, the offense entailing confession, and the grave offense entailing suspension—saying,
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:4.3_0: These are the five kinds of particular offense.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:5.1_0: Herein, what are the five grounds for worms?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:5.2_0: one who refrains from misbehaves the five offenses, for the sake of non-confusion, for the sake of non-restraint of repelling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:5.3_0: These are the five grounds for arousing energy.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:6.1_0: Herein, what is the seven offenses?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:6.2_0: an offense entailing expulsion, an offense entailing suspension, and an offense entailing confession,

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:9.1_0: Herein, what are the six kinds of disrespect?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:9.2_0: Respect for the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, the training, diligence, and hospitality.

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:12.1_0: Herein, what are the four failures?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:12.2_0: Failure in ethics, failure in view, and failure in livelihood.

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:13.1_0: Herein, what are the six origins of offenses?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:13.2_0: There are offenses that originate from the body, but not from speech or the mind.

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:13.4_0: There are offenses that originate from the body and speech, but not from the mind.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:13.5_0: There are offenses that originate from the body and the mind, but not from speech.

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.1_0: Herein, what are the six roots of arguments?
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant is irritable and hostile.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.3_0: Such a mendicant lacks respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and they don’t fulfill the training.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.6_0: creates a dispute in the Saṅgha.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.7_0: Disputes are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.8_0: If you see such a root of arguments in yourselves or others, you should try to give up this bad thing.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.9_0: If you don’t see it, you should practice so that it doesn’t come up in the future.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.10_0: That’s how to give up this bad root of arguments.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:14.11_0: In this way that bad root of disputes has no future effect.

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:15.2_0: envious and stingy, treacherous and deceitful, one who has bad desires and wrong views, or one who obstinately grasps his own views and only gives them up with difficulty.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:15.3_0: Any of these is disrespectful and undeferential toward the Teacher, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and he doesn’t fulfill the training.

ai-pli-tv-pvr4:18.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with bodily kindness, both in public and in private.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:18.3_0: this warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:19.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with verbal kindness, both in public and in private.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:19.2_0: this warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:20.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with mental kindness ...
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:20.2_0: this warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:21.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant shares without reservation any material possessions they have gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with their ethical spiritual companions.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:21.2_0: this warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:22.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the precepts shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. Those precepts are unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion. ...
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:22.2_0: this warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:23.1_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the view shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. That view is noble and emancipating, and leads one who practices it to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:23.2_0: this warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-pli-tv-pvr4:23.3_0: These are the six warm-hearted qualities.
